@lozzylozboz It's been a very difficult 18 months for people, hopefully we will see the end of the acute phase of the pandemic in the spring and things can return to normal.

@lozzylozboz I've regularly raised the need for practical solutions to deal with pandemic - widespread antigen testing (now available), better ventilation, especially in schools (now being funded) and more funding for HSE to increase capacity (happening).

@lozzylozboz Thanks for your feedback. I want to see restrictions lifted as soon as possible. In the interests of public health, the govt felt they needed the legal framework to continue until March. Any extension would need to be passed by the D√°il, I hope by then they will not be necessary

@GraceGalligan @hse Thanks for the feedback Grace, the HSE seem to have made significant improvements over the weekend. It's great to see so many people accessing their booster without issue. Efforts of @paulreiddublin & all the frontline staff are appreciated

#HousingforAll‚Äôs new Cro√≠ Connaithe (Towns) Fund will deliver for rural Ireland by assisting local authorities provide serviced sites to help people build their own homes or refurbish vacant properties, enabling people to live in small towns and villages in a sustainable way. https://t.co/TjDMM6khHE

#HousingforAll will deliver 90,000 new #SocialHousing units for lower income families and individuals. It will end the practice of long-term leasing and support Councils & approved housing bodies like @tuathhousing and @RespondHousing deliver tens of thousands of homes https://t.co/Bb2ZQsHNml

#HousingforAll will deliver 18,000 new #CostRental homes. These will allow people earning above the threshold for social housing support rent at discounted rents. New rules for renters will give more secure tenures and protect deposits. https://t.co/NztUbq82M7

#HousingforAll will deliver 36,000 #AffordablePurchase homes. These will be available to first-time buyers & people who need a fresh start (following a separation). #HousingforAll will support frontline organisations like @PMVTrust to eliminate #homelessness, by providing 1,200 ‚ÄòHousing First‚Äô tenancies over the next five years for people with a history of rough sleeping, or long-term use of emergency accommodation and who have complex needs https://t.co/CgBXPLCQZz
